titleStmt.title: Edward D. Townsend, Special Orders, No. 75
CWG12089

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.collection: 1st - 20th Regiments Kentucky Infantry Primary Source Documents

body.p:
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 75.} WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, February 15th, 1865.

33. The following named enlisted men of Company "C," 7th Kentucky Veteran Volunteers, now supposed to be with that regiment, will be discharged the service of the United States, upon the receipt of this Order at the place where they may be serving: --

Private Daniel Adams.
Private Sylvester Adams.
Private William F. Newell.
Private Ephraim B. Wilhoit.

By order of the Secretary of War:
E. D. TOWNSEND,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
E D Townsend
Assistant Adjutant General.

War Department
Adjutant Generals office
Washington Feby. 15' 1865
C Vet

Townsend E. D.
A. A. G.
discharging privates Daniel Adams, Sylvester Adams, Wm F. Newall & Eph. B. Wilhoit 7" Ky Vet Vols --
Recd A. G. O. Ky 21 Feby 1865
